title: Tunisia attack: Three members of same family shot by pool - BBC News
text:
Close share panel Media caption 'I will carry my grief every day' Three members of the same family died during the gun attack at a Tunisian resort in 2015 when they were on a "jolly boys' outing", a court heard. 
Charles Evans, 78, his son Adrian Evans, 49, and grandson Joel Richards, 19, were killed by Islamist Seifeddine Rezgui at the Imperial Marhaba Hotel. 
The only survivor from the holiday was Owen Richards, who was 16 when his brother, uncle and grandfather died. 
They were among 38 people killed by Rezgui before he was himself shot dead. 
In a statement read to the court, Mr Richards described holding his grandfather in his arms and hugging him as the gunfire started. 
When he opened his eyes he said he saw a hole in his grandfather's neck. "He's got me," Mr Evans said. 'Robbed future' 
Owen's mother, Suzanne Richards, also speaking at the inquests into the British deaths, said her eldest son had been "robbed" of his future at just 19. 
Joel Richards, from Wednesbury, was a football referee. He was killed alongside 29 other British holidaymakers on 26 June 2015 at the resort near Sousse. Image copyright Susanne Evans Image caption Joel Richards, pictured right, died alongside uncle Adrian Evans, grandfather Patrick Evans and 35 others 
"Part of me died that day when my beautiful child was taken from me," said Mrs Richards, on day 11 of the inquests. 
The four relatives, from the West Midlands, had booked the holiday to celebrate her Owen finishing his GCSE exams, she said. 
"This last holiday was just for the boys," Mrs Richards said. "It was their jolly boys' outing, just like Only Fools and Horses." 
But the three men were killed in the outdoor pool area of the hotel, where gunman Rezgui was shooting people after gaining entry from the beach. 
Mrs Richards said: "We take comfort that they stayed together in their last moments - protecting each other." 
In a BBC interview in 2015, Owen Richards said he missed his "perfect big brother" Joel every day. "He was definitely someone to look up to," he said.
